titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ernest Sturm Collection, approximately 1700-1925
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Clarke August 2007

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Variety of rare manuscripts relating to American and European history, art and literature. Also includes an 18th century manuscript of the Koran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Includes an original typescript of Woodrow Wilson on the States and the federal government, a letter and maps relating to the battle of Gettysburg; documents and letters signed by members of George Washington's first cabinet; documents relating to the Revolutionary Battle of Harlem Heights; documents signed by Catherine the Great relating to the Russian Navy; letters and documents signed by signers of the Declaration of Independence; items signed by American naval figures; a signed card and portraits of William Tecumseh Sherman; items signed by Napoleon Bonaparte, his family and generals; photos, letters, and documents relating to the Civil War; similar items of English literary and artistic figures; a letter of Edmund Burke; a letter and photos of Robert Browning; a letter of Robert E. Lee; printed copy of the United States Constitution dated 1787; letters and documents signed by American Presidents; transcript of a poem by Robert Louis Stevenson, and eighteenth century manuscripts copy of the Koran.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.persname: Napoleon I, Emperor of the French, 1769-1821

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original listing completed ca. 1997, updated in 2007.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Collected by Ernest Sturm, father of Ruth Foster Sturm, VC 1932.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ernest Sturm Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

The States and The Federal Government,
The States and The Federal Government,
Eyewitness Account of the Battle of Gettysburg,
Map of Pennsylvania Movement of Gibbons 2nd Army Corp,
Washington, George — Appointment of M. de Poirey,
Series IV: Battle of Harlem Heights
Hancock, John — Appointment of Josiah Hayden,
Hayden, Josiah — account of the Battle of Harlem Heights,
Order of the Committee of Safety On Enlistment of Men,

Collection of approximately 40 manuscript documents signed by Catherine, mostly relating to Russian Naval Matters, 1792-96. Bound in contemporary green velvet. Evidently removed from the Russian Royal Archive after the Revolution,
Series VI: Signers of the Declaration of Independence
Petition Signed by 42 Members Of Crew of Guerriere,
Series IX: Napoleon and His Generals
Bailly, Jean Sylvain- Mayor of Paris,
Bourgeois, R.- In Battle of Waterloo,
Clary, Julia Marie — Queen of Spain, Wife of Joseph Bonaparte,
Murat, Joachim — King of Naples, Cavalry Commander,
Walewska, Count Andrew — Son of Napoleon,
Series XI: English Literature and Art
Series XV: Constitution of The United States

"We the People of the United States…do Ordain and Establish this Constitution for the United States of America." Printed in 2 columns on 4 numbered pages in Philadelphia by Dunlap and Claypool (Evans, American Bibliography 20817),
Series XVI: Presidents of The United States
Album containing letters and documents signed by every United States president from George Washington through Franklin D. Roosevelt,
Autograph transcript signed of his poem, "To H.F. Brown,"
Series XVIII: Napoleon and His Family
Album containing approximately 10 letters and documents signed by Napoleon Bonaparte and members of the imperial family, including the Empress Josephine and Empress Mari-Louise,
Manuscript copy of the Koran, approximately 600 leaves,
